metadata.title: USN-5421-1 -- LibTIFF vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that LibTIFF incorrectly handled certain images. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affects  Ubuntu 14.04 ESM, Ubuntu 16.04 ESM, Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. (CVE-2020-35522)  Chintan Shah discovered that LibTIFF incorrectly handled memory when handling certain images. An attacker could possibly use this issue to  cause a crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-0561, CVE-2022-0562, CVE-2022-0891)  It was discovered that LibTIFF incorrectly handled certain images. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affects  Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, Ubuntu 20.04 LTS and Ubuntu 21.10. (CVE-2022-0865)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5421-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libtiff-opengl - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.5 libtiff-tools - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.5 libtiff5-dev - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.5 libtiff-dev - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.5 libtiff5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.5 libtiffxx5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.5 libtiff-doc - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.5 No subscription required
